poem:
Title: "Binibeca Vell Under Siege"

Once upon a scenic lane,
Whitewashed life, now stained with fame.
Tourists storm the cobblestone ocean, 
Spoiling serenity with their zealous devotion.
Menorcan whispers rise in revolt,
Yearning for peace, a justified jolt.
A village, echoed in apertured lenses,
Longs for silence, retreats behind fences.
Oh, Binibeca Vell, a pearl unbeknownst,
Now mirrored worldwide, your tranquil secret blown.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. But as its popularity swells on social media, setting off a stampede for selfies snapped along its cobblestone streets, residents are threatening to stop access to the village all". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
